publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1410 Mr Kenneth Gibson: Scottish Football Team-That the Parliament notes the views of the Home Secretary, Jack Straw, and his advocacy of a British football team to replace the English, Northern Irish, Scottish and Welsh teams and agrees that such a team should be formed with the following provisos: that the "all Britain" team be named "Scotland"; holds all home matches in Scotland; plays in dark blue; is managed by Craig Brown; ensures positive discrimination in terms of team selection for those currently eligible to play for Scotland; is administered by the Scottish Football Association and represented on UEFA and FIFA by that body and has "Flower of Scotland" as its anthem. Supported by: Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Richard Lochhead*, Fergus Ewing*, Andrew Wilson*, Colin Campbell*, Christine Grahame*, Linda Fabiani*

S1M-1410 Mr Kenneth Gibson: Scottish Football Team-That the Parliament notes the views of the Home Secretary, Jack Straw, and his advocacy of a British football team to replace the English, Northern Irish, Scottish and Welsh teams and agrees that such a team should be formed with the following provisos: that the "all Britain" team be named "Scotland"; holds all home matches in Scotland; plays in dark blue; is managed by Craig Brown; ensures positive discrimination in terms of team selection for those currently eligible to play for Scotland; is administered by the Scottish Football Association and represented on UEFA and FIFA by that body and has "Flower of Scotland" as its anthem. Supported by: Mr Kenny MacAskill, Richard Lochhead, Fergus Ewing, Andrew Wilson, Colin Campbell, Christine Grahame, Linda Fabiani, Michael Matheson*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Tricia Marwick*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Bruce Crawford*, Mr Andrew Welsh*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Fiona McLeod*, Mr John Munro*, Michael Russell*, Ms Sandra White*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Dr Winnie Ewing*
S1M-1410 Scottish Football Team (lodged on 29 November 2000) Dorothy-Grace Elder*
S1M-1410 Scottish Football Team (lodged on 29 November 2000) Alex Neil*
S1M-1410 Scottish Football Team (lodged on 29 November 2000) Mr Mike Rumbles*

S1M-1410 Mr Kenneth Gibson: Scottish Football Team-That the Parliament notes the views of the Home Secretary, Jack Straw, and his advocacy of a British football team to replace the English, Northern Irish, Scottish and Welsh teams and agrees that such a team should be formed with the following provisos: that the "all Britain" team be named "Scotland"; holds all home matches in Scotland; plays in dark blue; is managed by Craig Brown; ensures positive discrimination in terms of team selection for those currently eligible to play for Scotland; is administered by the Scottish Football Association and represented on UEFA and FIFA by that body and has "Flower of Scotland" as its anthem. Supported by: Mr Kenny MacAskill, Richard Lochhead, Fergus Ewing, Andrew Wilson, Colin Campbell, Christine Grahame, Linda Fabiani, Michael Matheson, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Adam Ingram, Tricia Marwick, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Bruce Crawford, Mr Andrew Welsh, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Fiona McLeod, Mr John Munro, Michael Russell, Ms Sandra White, Roseanna Cunningham, Dr Winnie Ewing, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Alex Neil, Mr Mike Rumbles, Fiona Hyslop*, Mr Duncan Hamilton*
S1M-1410 Scottish Football Team (lodged on 29 November 2000) Brian Adam*

S1M-1410 Mr Kenneth Gibson: Scottish Football Team-That the Parliament notes the views of the Home Secretary, Jack Straw, and his advocacy of a British football team to replace the English, Northern Irish, Scottish and Welsh teams and agrees that such a team should be formed with the following provisos: that the "all Britain" team be named "Scotland"; holds all home matches in Scotland; plays in dark blue; is managed by Craig Brown; ensures positive discrimination in terms of team selection for those currently eligible to play for Scotland; is administered by the Scottish Football Association and represented on UEFA and FIFA by that body and has "Flower of Scotland" as its anthem. Supported by: Mr Kenny MacAskill, Richard Lochhead, Fergus Ewing, Andrew Wilson, Colin Campbell, Christine Grahame, Linda Fabiani, Michael Matheson, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Adam Ingram, Tricia Marwick, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Bruce Crawford, Mr Andrew Welsh, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Fiona McLeod, Mr John Munro, Michael Russell, Ms Sandra White, Roseanna Cunningham, Dr Winnie Ewing, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Alex Neil, Mr Mike Rumbles, Fiona Hyslop, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Brian Adam
S1M-1410 Scottish Football Team (lodged on 29 November 2000) Kay Ullrich*

S1M-1410 Mr Kenneth Gibson: Scottish Football Team—That the Parliament notes the views of the Home Secretary, Jack Straw, and his advocacy of a British football team to replace the English, Northern Irish, Scottish and Welsh teams and agrees that such a team should be formed with the following provisos: that the "all Britain" team be named "Scotland"; holds all home matches in Scotland; plays in dark blue; is managed by Craig Brown; ensures positive discrimination in terms of team selection for those currently eligible to play for Scotland; is administered by the Scottish Football Association and represented on UEFA and FIFA by that body and has "Flower of Scotland" as its anthem.
